  • Method
com.sap.conn.idoc

Interface IDocSegment

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDocRecord, Serializable

    public interface IDocSegment
extends IDocRecord
    Interface that represents a single IDoc segment. The segment holds one data record of the associated document and offers a structured field access to all data elements.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        IDocSegment addChild(String segmentType)
              throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                     IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new child segment of the specified segment type to the segment tree. The new child segment will be positioned as the last leaf of this segment node. If meta data is available, it will be considered producing a syntactically correct segment tree hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be created and added.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty child segment.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if segmentType is null.
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the child segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if the given segment type is not a valid type in this context.

      • addChild

        IDocSegment addChild(String segmentType,
                     boolean subsequent)
              throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                     IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new child segment of the specified segment type to the segment tree. Depending on the given value of the subsequent argument, the new child segment will be positioned as the first (false) or the last leaf (true) within the child segment group of its own type. If meta data is available, it will be considered producing a syntactically correct segment tree hierarchy. In case there is no meta data available and the segment to add is the first one of the specified type, the subsequent argument specifies whether to add the new segment as the first (false) or as the last (true) child segment to this segment node.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be created and added.
        subsequent - specifies the position where to add the new segment.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty child segment.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if segmentType is null.
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the child segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if the given segment type is not a valid type in this context.

      • addSibling

        IDocSegment addSibling()
                throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                       IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new sibling segment of the same segment type as this segment node to the segment tree. The new sibling segment will be positioned as the last leaf of the parent segment node.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty sibling segment.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the sibling segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if this segment node is a root segment.

      • addSibling

        IDocSegment addSibling(boolean subsequent)
                throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                       IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new sibling segment of the same segment type as this segment node to the segment tree. Depending on the given value of the subsequent argument, the new sibling segment will be positioned as the first (false) or the last leaf (true) within this segment type's group.
        Parameters:
        subsequent - specifies the position where to add the new segment.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty sibling segment.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the sibling segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if this segment node is a root segment.

      • addSibling

        IDocSegment addSibling(String segmentType)
                throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                       IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new sibling segment of the specified segment type to the segment tree. The new sibling segment will be positioned as the last leaf of the parent segment node. If meta data is available, it will be considered producing a syntactically correct segment tree hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be created and added.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty sibling segment.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if segmentType is null.
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the sibling segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if this segment node is a root segment or the given segment type is not a valid type in this context.

      • addSibling

        IDocSegment addSibling(String segmentType,
                       boolean subsequent)
                throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                       IDocIllegalTypeException
        Creates and adds a new sibling segment of the specified segment type to the segment tree. Depending on the given value of the subsequent argument, the new sibling segment will be positioned as the first (false) or the last leaf (true) within the sibling segment group of its own type. If meta data is available, it will be considered producing a syntactically correct segment tree hierarchy. In case there is no meta data available and the segment to add is the first one of the specified type, the subsequent argument specifies whether to put the new segment directly before (false) or after (true) the group of this segment's type.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be created and added.
        subsequent - specifies the position where to add the new segment.
        Returns:
        the created and added empty sibling segment.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if segmentType is null.
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the sibling segment type is not available.
        IDocIllegalTypeException - if this segment node is a root segment or the given segment type is not a valid type in this context.

      • checkChildSegmentsOccurrenceLimits

        void checkChildSegmentsOccurrenceLimits()
                                 throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                                        IDocSyntaxException
        Checks if the number of added child segments is within the range of allowed occurrences for each segment type. The minimum and maximum occurrence limits for segments and segment groups will be checked.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the child segments is not available.
        IDocSyntaxException - if there have been not enough or too many child segments of at least one type added to this segment node.

      • checkMandatoryChildSegments

        void checkMandatoryChildSegments()
                          throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                                 IDocSyntaxException
        Checks if all mandatory child segments and child segment groups of this segment node have been added.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the meta data for the child segments is not available.
        IDocSyntaxException - if at least one mandatory child segment or child segment group of this segment node has not yet been added.

      • checkSyntax

        void checkSyntax()
          throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                 IDocSyntaxException
        Checks the segment's and all its subtree segment's syntax using all possible syntax checks. This is done recursively so that the whole segment subtree including this segment node will be checked.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the some meta data within the segment tree is not available.
        IDocSyntaxException - if some syntax error has been detected.

      • checkSyntax

        void checkSyntax(int options)
          throws IDocMetaDataUnavailableException,
                 IDocSyntaxException
        Checks the segment's and/or its child segment's syntax according to the specified options.
        Possible options:
        • IDocDocument.CHECK_SEGMENT_FIELD_VALUES
        • IDocDocument.CHECK_WITHOUT_SEGMENT_FIELD_DATATYPES
        • IDocDocument.CHECK_MANDATORY_CHILD_SEGMENTS
        • IDocDocument.CHECK_CHILD_SEGMENTS_OCCURRENCE_LIMITS
        • IDocDocument.CHECK_CURRENT_SEGMENT_ONLY
        The options can be combined using the bitwise OR operator "|". If the option IDocDocument.CHECK_CURRENT_SEGMENT_ONLY is omitted the syntax checks will be made recursively so that the whole segment subtree including this segment node will be checked. Otherwise only this segment will be checked.
        Parameters:
        options - the options for the syntax check.
        Throws:
        IDocMetaDataUnavailableException - if the some meta data within the segment tree is not available.
        IDocSyntaxException - if some syntax error has been detected.

      • disableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void disableFieldDatatypeChecking()
        Disables the immediate field datatype checking for the segment and for the whole child segment subtree. If disabled, no datatype check is done for a single field when it is set.

        Caution: This method should be used with care. Sending IDocs with illegal field contents that are violating the field's defined datatype may cause ABAP system dumps and result in unrecognized partial loss of data when later being processed in an AS ABAP system.

        Specified by:
        disableFieldDatatypeChecking in interface IDocRecord
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • disableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void disableFieldDatatypeChecking(boolean applyToChildren)
        Disables the immediate field datatype checking for the segment and if specified also for the whole child segment subtree. If disabled, no datatype check is done for a single field when it is set.

        Caution: This method should be used with care. Sending IDocs with illegal field contents that are violating the field's defined datatype may cause ABAP system dumps and result in unrecognized partial loss of data when later being processed in an AS ABAP system.

        Parameters:
        applyToChildren - specifying true also disables the immediate field datatype checking for the whole child segment subtree, specifying false does not change the child segments' settings for immediate field datatype checking.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • disableFieldValueChecking

        void disableFieldValueChecking()
        Disables the immediate field value checking for the segment and for the whole child segment subtree. If disabled, no value check is done for a single field when it is set.
        Specified by:
        disableFieldValueChecking in interface IDocRecord

      • disableFieldValueChecking

        void disableFieldValueChecking(boolean applyToChildren)
        Disables the immediate field value checking for the segment and if specified also for the whole child segment subtree. If disabled, no value check is done for a single field when it is set.
        Parameters:
        applyToChildren - specifying true also disables the immediate field value checking for the whole child segment subtree, specifying false does not change the child segments' settings for immediate field value checking.

      • enableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void enableFieldDatatypeChecking()
        Enables the immediate field datatype checking for the segment and for the whole child segment subtree. If enabled, a datatype check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocConversionException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Specified by:
        enableFieldDatatypeChecking in interface IDocRecord
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • enableFieldDatatypeChecking

        void enableFieldDatatypeChecking(boolean applyToChildren)
        Enables the immediate field datatype checking for the segment and if specified also for the whole child segment subtree. If enabled, a datatype check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocConversionException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Parameters:
        applyToChildren - specifying true also enables the immediate field datatype checking for the whole child segment subtree, specifying false does not change the child segments' settings for immediate field datatype checking.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.11

      • enableFieldValueChecking

        void enableFieldValueChecking()
        Enables the immediate field value checking for the segment and for the whole child segment subtree. If enabled, a value check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocSyntaxException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Specified by:
        enableFieldValueChecking in interface IDocRecord

      • enableFieldValueChecking

        void enableFieldValueChecking(boolean applyToChildren)
        Enables the immediate field value checking for the segment and if specified also for the whole child segment subtree. If enabled, a value check is immediately done for each single field when it is set. So an additional IDocSyntaxException may be possibly thrown on future calls to a field's set-method.
        Parameters:
        applyToChildren - specifying true also enables the immediate field value checking for the whole child segment subtree, specifying false does not change the child segments' settings for immediate field value checking.

        IDocSegmentIterator getDescendantsIterator()

      • getFirstChild

        IDocSegment getFirstChild(String segmentType)
        Returns the first child segment of the specified segment type from the segment's child list.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        Returns:
        the first child segment of the specified segment type from the segment's child list or null if the segment does not have any children of that type.

      • getFirstChild

        IDocSegment getFirstChild(String segmentType,
                          int fieldIndex,
                          String fieldValue)
        Returns the first child segment of the specified segment type whose data meets the following condition: The record field element at the specified index position must be equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldIndex - index of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the first child segment of the specified segment type meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any children of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fieldIndex is out of range for the specified segment type (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • getFirstChild

        IDocSegment getFirstChild(String segmentType,
                          String fieldName,
                          String fieldValue)
                   throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns the first child segment of the specified segment type whose data meets the following condition: The record field element with the specified name must be equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldName - name of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the first child segment of the specified segment type meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any children of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist within the specified segment type.

      • getFirstDescendant

        IDocSegment getFirstDescendant(String segmentType)
        Returns the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree. The first descendant segment is determined by the breadth first traversal order.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        Returns:
        the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree or null if the segment does not have any descendants of that type.

      • getFirstDescendant

        IDocSegment getFirstDescendant(String segmentType,
                               int fieldIndex,
                               String fieldValue)
        Returns the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree whose data meets the following condition: The record field element at the specified index position must be equal to the given value. The first descendant segment is determined by the breadth first traversal order.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldIndex - index of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any descendants of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fieldIndex is out of range for the specified segment type (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • getFirstDescendant

        IDocSegment getFirstDescendant(String segmentType,
                               String fieldName,
                               String fieldValue)
                        throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree whose data meets the following condition: The record field element with the specified name must be equal to the given value. The first descendant segment is determined by the breadth first traversal order.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldName - name of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the first descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any descendants of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist within the specified segment type.

      • getHierarchyLevel

        int getHierarchyLevel()
        Returns the segment's hierarchy level. Root segments have hierarchy level 0. Child segments have a hierarchy level which is one higher than the hierarchy level of their parent segment.
        Returns:
        the segment's hierarchy level.

      • getLastChild

        IDocSegment getLastChild()
        Returns the last child segment of the segment's child list.
        Returns:
        the last child segment of the segment's child list or null if the segment does not have any children.

      • getLastChild

        IDocSegment getLastChild(String segmentType)
        Returns the last child segment of the specified segment type from the segment's child list.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        Returns:
        the last child segment of the specified segment type from the segment's child list or null if the segment does not have any children of that type.

      • getLastChild

        IDocSegment getLastChild(String segmentType,
                         int fieldIndex,
                         String fieldValue)
        Returns the last child segment of the specified segment type whose data meets the following condition: The record field element at the specified index position must be equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldIndex - index of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the last child segment of the specified segment type meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any children of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fieldIndex is out of range for the specified segment type (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

      • getLastChild

        IDocSegment getLastChild(String segmentType,
                         String fieldName,
                         String fieldValue)
                  throws IDocFieldNotFoundException
        Returns the last child segment of the specified segment type whose data meets the following condition: The record field element with the specified name must be equal to the given value.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        fieldName - name of the record field element to be compared.
        fieldValue - value that the record field element must be equal to.
        Returns:
        the last child segment of the specified segment type meeting the given data condition or null if the segment does not have any children of that type or none of them meets the given data condition.
        Throws:
        IDocFieldNotFoundException - if a field with the given name does not exist within the specified segment type.

      • getNext

        IDocSegment getNext()
        Returns the next segment of the segment tree. The next segment is determined by the depth first traversal order.
        Returns:
        the next segment of the segment tree or null if the segment is the last one.

      • getNext

        IDocSegment getNext(String segmentType)
        Returns the next segment of the specified segment type from the segment tree. The next segment is determined by the depth first traversal order.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        Returns:
        the next segment of the specified segment type from the segment tree or null if there are no more segments of that type following this segment.

                    int fieldIndex,
                    String fieldValue)

        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if fieldIndex is out of range for the specified segment type (index < 0 || index >= getNumFields()).

        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be returned.
        Returns:
        the next descendant segment of the specified segment type from the segment's subtree or null if the segment does not have any descendants of that type.

        Returns the number of the segment's child segments.
        Returns:
        the number of the segment's child segments.

      • getNumChildren

        int getNumChildren(String segmentType)
        Returns the number of the segment's child segments of the specified type.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be counted.
        Returns:
        the number of the segment's child segments of the specified type.

      • getNumDescendants

        int getNumDescendants()
        Returns the number of the segment's descendant segments. That is the number of all segments in the segment's subtree.
        Returns:
        the number of the segment's descendant segments.

      • getNumDescendants

        int getNumDescendants(String segmentType)
        Returns the number of the segment's descendant segments of the specified segment type. That is the number of all segments of the specified type in the segment's subtree.
        Parameters:
        segmentType - the segment type to be counted.
        Returns:
        the number of the segment's descendant segments of the specified segment type.

        Returns:
        the segment's parent segment or null if the segment is a root segment.

      • getPrevious

        IDocSegment getPrevious()
        Returns the previous segment of the segment tree. The previous segment is determined by the reverse depth first traversal order.
        Returns:
        the previous segment of the segment tree or null if the segment is the first one.

      • getSegmentMetaData

        IDocSegmentMetaData getSegmentMetaData()
        Returns the segment's meta data.
        Returns:
        the segment's meta data or null if it is not available.

      • getSegmentNumber

        String getSegmentNumber()
        Returns the segment number string which was used in the last RFC transmission for this segment. The segment number string typically is a zero-padded numeric string with a length of 6 characters, e.g. "000001".

        Note: When an IDoc document is sent, the receiving system is not obliged to keep the sequence of segments and the sent segment numbers. It is possible that the communication partner system reorders and renumbers the received segments. This will especially happen if the receiving system is configured to filter or drop unneeded or unknown segment types. However, segment numbers of received IDoc documents are always offered by this method exactly as they were sent from the communication partner system.

        Returns:
        the segment's number string or null if the document, which this segment belongs to, has not been sent yet or its segment tree was modified since its last RFC transmission.
        Since:
        IDocLibrary 3.0.13

      • getType

        String getType()
        Returns the type of the segment.
        Returns:
        the type of the segment.

      • isChild

        boolean isChild()
        Checks whether the segment is a child segment.
        Returns:
        true if the segment has a parent; false otherwise.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf()
        Checks whether the segment is a leaf segment.
        Returns:
        true if the segment does not have any children; false otherwise.

      • isParent

        boolean isParent()
        Checks whether the segment is a parent segment.
        Returns:
        true if the segment has at least one child; false otherwise.

      • isRoot

        boolean isRoot()
        Checks whether the segment is a root segment.
        Returns:
        true if the segment has no parent; false otherwise.

      • remove

        boolean remove()
        Removes the segment from the document and its segment tree.
        Returns:
        true if the segment was removed; false otherwise (e.g. in case of the segment being a root segment).

      • removeChild

        boolean removeChild(IDocSegment child)
        Removes the specified child segment from the document and its segment tree.
        Parameters:
        child - the child segment to be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the segment was removed; false otherwise (e.g. in case the specified segment was no child segment of this segment).
